---

## GAD-7 vs PBQ

Harmony is a remarkable tool created to greatly simplify the often complex and time-consuming process of comparing psychological and social science questionnaires. This software uses natural language processing and generative AI models to accelerate the harmonisation process. One comparison it vastly benefits is the comparison of the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and Preschool Behaviour Questionnaire (PBQ), or simply, GAD-7 vs PBQ. The GAD-7 is a seven-item instrument intended to evaluate the severity of generalised anxiety disorder, asking individuals to rate their symptoms over the past two weeks. On the other hand, the PBQ is a 52-item questionnaire focused on a multitude of children's behaviours. Comparing these two tools (GAD-7 vs PBQ) manually would be time-consuming and likely subjective, but Harmony has dramatically simplified this process by employing advanced language models. In using Harmony to facilitate GAD-7 vs PBQ comparison, researchers simply select these questionnaires from Harmony's extensive database, or import them in PDF format. Following this, Harmony's AI analyzes the items in each tool, provides a percentage match between each item, and does so in multiple languages. The Harmony web interface makes this process incredibly user-friendly, providing an indispensable tool to psychology and social science professionals in streamlining the GAD-7 vs PBQ harmonisation process.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and PBQ

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and PBQ into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PBQ into Harmony</a> - compare PBQ with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
